conclusion: Use the Ideal Gas Law and properties of the cycle to determine temperature at State B.
Ideal Gas Law: PV = nRT, where P is pressure, V is volume, n is moles, R is gas constant, T is temperature.
State A has coordinates (P1, V1) and temperature T0. State B has coordinates (P2, V1).
n and R are constants throughout the cycle, allowing ratio of pressures and volumes to be proportional to ratio of temperatures.
Apply Ideal Gas Law at State A: P1 V1 = n R T0.
Apply Ideal Gas Law at State B: P2 V1 = n R TB.
Equate Ideal Gas Law expressions for States A and B: (P1 V1)/T0 = (P2 V1)/TB.
